messages: a02622c45eb22ef57d99330e2b404407 (18:47): helloo opensol
a02622c45eb22ef57d99330e2b404407 (18:48): its a great Sunday morning in we michigan..
a02622c45eb22ef57d99330e2b404407 (18:50): think I'll experiment with iscsi on sol 10 today
a02622c45eb22ef57d99330e2b404407 (18:51): iscsi has good price/performance compared to fibre channel
778d97eab00032b3f494f2988d83c295 (18:51): how does it compare to sata?
a02622c45eb22ef57d99330e2b404407 (18:52): iscsi can be built from sata drives
a02622c45eb22ef57d99330e2b404407 (18:53): the signaling over the network is iscsi-type
443a9547033ec9d695ae9d29e8df98b1 (18:53): pirce/lowperformance :)
a02622c45eb22ef57d99330e2b404407 (18:54): sure but how fast is fast ? :)
a02622c45eb22ef57d99330e2b404407 (18:54): 80 gb/sec could be fast for some types of video editing for example
6caff723a014fddb53dff9e10dd9e175 (18:55): the solaris iscsi initiator is quite ok, the target however is barely useable
a02622c45eb22ef57d99330e2b404407 (18:55): was wondering about that..
443a9547033ec9d695ae9d29e8df98b1 (18:56): the netapp simulator is quite ok to play with
a02622c45eb22ef57d99330e2b404407 (18:57): there is a 'third-party' Breakthrough Systems which advertises scsi target mode drivers for solaris
a02622c45eb22ef57d99330e2b404407 (18:59): is the simulator from oracle ?
443a9547033ec9d695ae9d29e8df98b1 (18:59): the netapp simulator is from netapp...
e55e49dbdc0b3b324ddec7711f265523 (19:00): there is a netapp simulator !? interesting
a02622c45eb22ef57d99330e2b404407 (19:00): ah ok, and anyone can get it ?
443a9547033ec9d695ae9d29e8df98b1 (19:00): anyone with now access
6caff723a014fddb53dff9e10dd9e175 (19:00): they appear to require a netapp serial/system id, which means you have to have a netapp already :)
443a9547033ec9d695ae9d29e8df98b1 (19:00): i think its downloadable as a now guest
a02622c45eb22ef57d99330e2b404407 (19:01): how do you get a now guest account ?
6caff723a014fddb53dff9e10dd9e175 (19:01): apply for one
a02622c45eb22ef57d99330e2b404407 (19:01): so fill out the form on their site ?
a02622c45eb22ef57d99330e2b404407 (19:10): i don't have real Sun hardware :( so when logging into one of the sol 10 experimental machines just now
a02622c45eb22ef57d99330e2b404407 (19:11): and realizing the backspace key mapping was wrong I remembered about the Sun keyboard on the old IPC
a02622c45eb22ef57d99330e2b404407 (19:11): if I remember correctly it has 2 'backspace' keys
a02622c45eb22ef57d99330e2b404407 (19:12): so backspace and delete, the way they're mapped on the crt terminal emulator work the way Sun intended..
a02622c45eb22ef57d99330e2b404407 (19:13): I need an 'x86' sun keyboard
1ab6e9f9996c38f2e4eac24956b2b6cf (19:13): if you want your backspace on your standard pc keyboard to work, i belive you can type set tty erase <bkspace-key>
a02622c45eb22ef57d99330e2b404407 (19:14): yes you can and then it acts the way you'd expect
a02622c45eb22ef57d99330e2b404407 (19:15): you can setup the configuration on the crt terminal so its mapped that way
1ab6e9f9996c38f2e4eac24956b2b6cf (19:15): i don't know that a sun x86 keyboard will help tho, i have one hooked up to my pc at work and when i ssh into a sun box i still have to fix the backspace key
da0e57e706a98c1977faf3a3cf26b5eb (19:15): cane someone explain to me, hy you cant have a cname like ( myname cname myname.domain.com) where you have an A record myname.domain.com 192.168.1.10
1ab6e9f9996c38f2e4eac24956b2b6cf (19:16): but that might just be the terminal putty is emulating
62115b1ea90366cbcce7a495fa28cbce (19:17): Snake007uk: a cname pointing at itself?
443a9547033ec9d695ae9d29e8df98b1 (19:18): Snake007uk: i think you're just after search domain.com in resolv.conf?
443a9547033ec9d695ae9d29e8df98b1 (19:18): Snake007uk: if your after the shortname
da0e57e706a98c1977faf3a3cf26b5eb (19:19): hali,  yeah im after a  short name, i thought, it could, do that
62115b1ea90366cbcce7a495fa28cbce (19:19): so you want 'search domain.com' in resolv.conf, yes.. or put stuff in /etc/hosts
da0e57e706a98c1977faf3a3cf26b5eb (19:20): got it thanks
